intro: Palura tanakana, commonly known as the narrow-leaf palura, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, often woody stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Palura tanakana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
